column4: Is there any way I can generate the xorg.conf file from the current settings? I need to make sure that it uses intel drivers and there being no xorg.conf I do not know where to look for that.
yes, open teminal
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
what does that do exactly? :)
it's an automatism , that reads hardwareinfo and (re-)creates xorg.conf with basic settings
okay nice
this gets me nothing actually. it doesnt generate a xorg.conf at all and I googled it to see what it looks like but I dont get a config menu, just my shell back.
gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf   (wath up, case-sensitiv)
the file doesnt exist, should I touch it?
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg    << should be there after, sure no typos ?
yes, it just yields me the shell
if you run it a second time, shall also tell overwriting/backing up old one
it doesnt seem to be doing anything, the file stays empty
sudo apt-get install pastebinit
(you can copy and paste from messenger to trml to avoid typos)
pastebinit /etc/X11/xorg.conf
give url from last cmd here
I know how to open a file. its empty. the reconfigure isnt doing anything.
which version of ubuntu are you running ? no x installed (unlikely) ?
pastebinit /var/log/Xorg.0.log
https://gist.github.com/55a3f6a4cbf8e8b03d6a
you can see that its trying to use 4 display drivers or something :S
